qas.question: What is a problem with racial assignments?
How many people have a varied ancestry?
When were periods of numerous interracial relationships in the U.S.?
Who do many people who identify as white have for ancestors?
What percentage of African ancestry were 30% of college students identifying as white estimated to have?

context: One problem with these assignments is <a0_0>admixture<a0_0/>. <a1_0>Many<a1_0/> people have a highly varied ancestry. For example, in the United States, <a2_0>colonial and early federal history<a2_0/> were periods of numerous interracial relationships, both outside and inside slavery. This has resulted in a majority of people who identify as African American having some European ancestors. Similarly, many people who identify as white have some <a3_0>African<a3_0/> ancestors. In a survey in a northeastern U.S. university of college students who identified as "white", about 30% were estimated to have up to <a4_0>10%<a4_0/> African ancestry.
